About This Game



Only the Dead Survive.
A massive deep-space mining ship goes dark after unearthing a strange artifact on a distant planet. Engineer Isaac Clarke embarks on the repair mission, only to uncover a nightmarish blood bath  the ship's crew horribly slaughtered and infected by alien scourge. Now Isaac is cut off, trapped, and engaged in a desperate fight for survival.

  • Strategically dismember the Necromorph enemies limb by bloody limb.
  • Zero gravity combat means terror can strike from anywhere.
  • Uncover the horrific truth of this shocking thriller.
READ MORE

System Requirements

    • Supported OS: Microsoft Windows® XP SP2 or Vista
    • Processor: 2.8 GHz or faster
    • Memory: 1 GB RAM or more for Windows XP (2 GB for Vista)
    • Graphics: DirectX® 9.0c compatible video card, Shader Model 3.0 required, 256 MB or better, NVIDIA GeForce 6800 or better (7300, 7600 GS, and 8500 are below minimum system requirements), ATI X1600 Pro or better (X1300, X1300 Pro and HD2400 are below minimum system requirements)
    • Hard Drive: 7.5 GB free space
    • Sound: DirectX® 9.0c compatible sound card
    • INTERNET CONNECTION, ONLINE AUTHENTICATION AND ACCEPTANCE OF END USER LICENSE AGREEMENT REQUIRED TO PLAY. EA MAY RETIRE ONLINE FEATURES AFTER 30 DAYS NOTICE POSTED ON WWW.EA.COM.
READ MORE

Posted: August 23
Alien + The Thing + Event Horizon = Dead Space


Top-notch atmosphere and a compelling story.

Mouse sensitivity is crap, though turning v-sync off at the NVIDIA Control Panel fixes that right up.


10/10 would planet crack in restricted system again.

Jahandar
881 products in account
23 reviews
Recommended
42.5 hrs on record
Posted: June 19
I finally got around to this game. I played it bit by bit over time and it was quite enjoyable.

Although it's in the horror genre, I didn't find it to be too scary, instead it felt like a slower-paced FPS dungeon crawler in space, which was great.


I loved the theme of using engineering tools as weapons, and they made things interesting by making it more effective to dismember the enemies rather than just shooting for headshots or at the center of mass.


There are a few caveats though.

It is not a very good port. The mouse cursor feels terrible by default. You can fix the in-game mouse by locking the framerate to 60fps (see the PC Gaming Wiki for info) and use the keyboard for the inventory and menus.

I also didn't care for the default camera view, so increasing the FOV using the Widescreen Fixer app helped a lot. I set mine to +0.31.


In all, it was a good game and I am looking forward to moving on in the series, hoping that a little more thought was put into the ports for the sequels.
Read More

Serest
117 products in account
5 reviews
Recommended
20.1 hrs on record
Posted: June 21
This game was released in 2008 and I am playing it for the first time here in 2015. I have to say this is a fan-freaking-tastic game.

Pros:
-Graphics and textures were amazing for an older game.
-The sounds and music in the game were fantastic. Made for some good scary moments. I jumped plenty of times.
-Great upgrade and progression path of weapons and items.
-Unique game physics and in game resource management.
-Loved the 3rd person perspective.
-Great weapon choices and secondary fire actions.

Cons:
-At times, felt a little repetitive and tedious having to always run back to the start to finish the missions.
-At times, camera angles and aiming were difficult in tight corridors.
-While the in game save feature is pretty unique, it got tedious constantly finding a save point and having to click through 3 screens to save.

Overall, I would give this game a strong 8.5/10.
I would highly recommend playing and picking it up on the next Steam sale.
